text: What's the plan for tomorrow?
Ace the quiz, meet at 1pm, see TA refine stories, breakdown into tasks, talk design and architecture, start v1
sounds good
Good
yea sounds good
i feel like the work load will be insane with our user stories I'll meantion to the TA our current technical knowledge
yea man this project is going to be hard lol
unless we find a SUPER easy to implement open source library for creating live chat apps....
that would take away like 80% of the workload ^^
the previous semester they had to do a schedual generator that seems like a joke compared to our requirements.
Hmmm we should rank our user stories in order of difficulty, from easiest to gardest
Hardest
in class the teacher said that each user story should doable in a 1-2 week sprint
if the task is too complexe it is called an EPIC and it should broken down into a few user stories that can done in 1-2 weeks
example of EPIC he used is backing up a whole hard drive
I think that there's a big difference between the coding effort required for this project in the eyes of the prof and the TA
Me definitely need a talk after tutorial tomorrow
We
yea for sure
i'll be free
Same
we need to talk to the TA about it aswell
I remember the prof saying in class something along the lines of: "You won't be able to recreate moodle for this project - it's too hard"
exactly
Then the TA said something along the lines of: "The project you guys will be working on will be like moodle"
lmao
It is a fact that tutorials and lectures are not sync
Well we can always modify the user stories right?
According to the client
ya I got the impression that he was sort of validating out user stories tomorrow
so if anything we change them after the tutorial then were ready for the sprint.. hopefully
Can we meet before like at 1pm sharp because i have another tutorial that starts at 2:15
fine by me, but were almost definitely going to need to discuss some things as a group after the tutorial
we would obviously fill you in if you miss anything
Ok cool
For communication our stories dont specify live chat
So just a static message inbox is pretty simple ive done it last semester
Live chat would need ajax stuff which idk anything about
yep that would be way better
I think either way were gunna have some ajax
And yeah i feel like 2 weeks is a ridiculously short window to get started
im comfortable with it
Yeah at some point youre right
one thing that definitely confused me, is that the first part of a project is not iterative cuz ur building the platform itself
like the skeleton
Haha
you can't really write a user story like
As a user I want to be aware that theres an apache Server running on a remote VM so that the website can be served to users
it doesn't make sense
anyways hopefully our TA will clear everything up for us
Haha yeah like last semester for comp353 we had a server and database set up for us and it took us a month just to connect all the ends together and deploy our website
Now we have 2 weeks to do this and a couple of features
its pretty messed up
its a good thing u took databases cuz were gunna want to use one to store the messages
im hoping we can use a NoSQL databse. I've heard they're more intuitive and easy to pick up
Yah i can be the database engineer. I worked with MySQL, ive heard about noSQL, theyre kinda similar
dope
